alert.note: Alert for Calvert; St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 05 at 6:29PM EDT until August 05 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern St. Marys County in southern Maryland... South central Calvert County in southern Maryland... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 629 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Greenwell State Park to 7 miles northwest of Leonardtown, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Leonardtown, Cuckold Creek, Greenwell State Park, Saint Leonard Creek, Town Creek, California, Lusby, Saint Leonard, Hollywood, Long Beach, Calvert Beach, Bushwood, Clements, Chaptico, Sandgates, Sotterley, Loveville, Oakley, Compton and Morganza. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
